results.title: Christo: wrapped coast
results.brief_description: Examines the art event by Bulgarian artsist Christo, of wrapping a section of the Little Bay coastline near Sydney. As the wrapping progresses, the coastline takes on a glacial appearance, changes to a wrapped bundle, and is finally ripped apart by the force of the wind. Narrated by Kevin McCarthy, photographed and edited by Christian Blackwood.

results.title: Christo's valley curtain
results.creator_credit: Maysles Films, Inc., Thomas Handloser, Ellen Gifford, David Maysles and Albert Maysles
results.brief_description: A documentary by the Maysles Brothers focusing on the construction of a five hundred foot valley curtain by Bulgarian artist Christo. Examines the erection of the veil across Rifle Gap (part of the Grand Canyon) and presents smaller art works by Christo which were used in preparation for the event.

results.title: Christmas videos volume 4 (S)
results.brief_description: This tape features 7 Christmas cartoons including: “Rudolph the red nosed reindeer”; the reindeer with the red nose becomes the hero of Christmas: “Christmas comes but once a year”; a stranger makes Christmas a joyous one for a group of orphans: “The Kids in the shoe”; instead of sleeping, the children in the shoe sing: “Robin Hood makes good”; three squirrels masquerade as Robin Hood while a hungry fox pretends to be Maid Marion: “A Bout with a trout”; Lulu finds herself in some serious trouble when she goes fishing”: “A Day at the zoo”; the animals are out to entertain from the confines of their cages: “Bars and stripes forever”; a little convict takes the blame for a tougher crim.

results.title: Christmas videos volume 3 (S)
results.brief_description: This tape features 6 Christmas cartoons including: “Hector’s hectic life”; Prince’s plans for a trouble free Christmas are threatened by a litter of puppies: “Little Grey Neck”; Little Grey Neck learns to fend for himself when the other geese migrate South leaving him alone: “Hamateur night”; Fleabag McPoodle and his singing insects and a wolf reciting Shakespeare are only some of the contestants in this amusing competition: “Mutt and Jeff in westward whoa”; Mutt and Jeff are up to no good in the wild west: “The Tin soldier”; the adventures of a little tin soldier: “The Christmas visitor”; a cartoon version of the famous poem, ‘twas the night before Christmas’.

results.title: Christmas videos volume 2 (S)
results.brief_description: This tape features 7 cartoons united by the theme of Christmas. They include: “Snow foolin’”; the first day of winter is celebrated in fine style by the animals; “Toys will be toys”; the toys from Santa’s workshop come to life when the toyshop closes: “A Christmas visit”; a young boy holidays to the South Pole to visit his father: “Have you got any castles?”; a zany cartoon review of recogniseable books, films and film stars: “Gold rush daze”; a tale of gold mining set in California over 100 years ago: “The Wild swans”; children are turned into swans by the King’s evil new wife, all except one child: “Hasty and the Princess”; a country boy requires some animal assistance when he is set a challenging task by the King.

results.title: Christmas videos volume 1 (S)
results.brief_description: This tape features 6 Christmas cartoons including: “Santa’s surprise”; Santa is given a present when the children hiding in his sleigh clean up his home: “Jack Frost”; the forest creatures happily greet the arrival of Jack Frost: “To Spring”; the elves work at imbuing the earth with warm spring colours while Old Father Winter works against them: “Somewhere in Dreamland”; what looks like being a sad Christmas for a poor mother and her two children is turned into something special by the friendly townspeople: “Fony fables”; a review of classic stories: “The Candlemaker”; a young boy making church candles for Christmas is distracted by his pet mouse.

results.title: Christmas under fire
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit and GPO Film Unit
results.brief_description: An emotional commentary, written and spoken by Quentin Reynolds, one of WWII’s best reporters, on the eve of his departure back to America, with a film report on how British people were celebrating their first Christmas under blitz conditions in 1940. Shows them in shelters, on watch in fields, in the city and at their posts proving to the world that the people of Britain are equal to their testing, unbeaten, unconquered and unafraid. Carols sung by the choir of Kings College Chapel, Cambridge.

results.title: Christmas presence
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, AFI [au] and Glen Whelan
results.brief_description: A story about family estrangement and father son relationships. A dying man makes contact with his son after twenty years. His son, struggling with his own role as a father invites him to Christmas lunch.

results.title: Christmas lace
results.creator_credit: Ko-Zac Productions, George Mendeluk and Linda Sorensen
results.brief_description: Animated at the beginning, this film is a Christmas story of a girl and her grandmother, both lacemakers, living in rural Quebec in the 1880s. A Christmas bowl left for the Baby Jesus one Christmas Eve is taken by a thief who eventually repays his debt. The film embodies some elements of French-Canadian culture. Special appearance by Monique Mercure and Marcel Sabourin. Cast includes Michael Cote, Guylaine Croteau, Germaine Lemyre and Roger Garand. Story by Linda Sorensen. Suitable for upper primary level.
